subject: Re: Problem with JUnit 3.7 and Ant 1.4
msgSnippet: ... result ... to ... remember ... Vladimir, thanks for the suggestion - it worked!
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@b...> wrote:
> Mike,
>
> Thank you very much for this well formulated question. Normally
> questions are more "how can I test this or that?" ...
>
> The Swing application implements it's own ClassLoader and this
result
> into several problems. I'm not 100% sure of the solution but try
to
> define your junit task with a 'fork="yes"' parameter. If I
remember
> well, this solves some problems with the ClassLoader.
>
> > <junit printsummary="on" fork="yes">
>
>

Vladimir, thanks for the suggestion - it worked!

^^^^^^^^^^
>
>
> > <formatter type="plain"/>
> > <classpath refid="junitpath"/>
> > <!-- <classpaty refid="classpath"/>-->
> > <test
> > name="ewm.timepay.empassign.model.EmpAssignModelTest"/>
> > </junit>
>
>
> Hope it helps,
>
>
> -Vladimir
>
> --
> Vladimir Bossicard
> www.bossicard.com
